intro: Rouhamon stans, commonly known as the mountain lily, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It is characterized by its tall, slender stem and large, showy white or pale purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern, and its roots are fibrous and adapted to absorb nutrients from rocky soil. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its unique beauty and ecological significance, it is a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists alike.
